atod.db package¶

This modulde contains tools for any DB-related tasks.

If you want to use session, please, use scoped version, it’s needed to ensure thread-safety (or, it’s also possible, I’m using SQLAlchemy not entirely right).

Submodules¶

atod.db.content module¶

atod.db.create_tables module¶

atod.db.create_tables.create_tables()¶

atod.db.schemas module¶

There are a lot of variables in descriptions of every subject in the game, so db schemas are pretty complex to write in static form. This file provides interface to all schemas through function calls.

atod.db.schemas.get_abilities_schema()¶
atod.db.schemas.get_abilities_specs_columns()¶

Returns names of columns in abilties_specs table.

atod.db.schemas.get_abilities_specs_schema()¶

Creates schema of abilities table.

Raises:
ValueError: if key contain 2 or more different types and
they are not float and int.
Returns:
scheme (dict): keys - all properties in cleaned abilities,
items - python
atod.db.schemas.get_heroes_columns()¶

Returns list of columns names for heroes table.

atod.db.schemas.get_heroes_schema()¶

Reads heroes schema form db_schemas and returns types mapped to sql.

Returns:
heroes_schema (dict): mapping of column name to its SQLAlchemy
type
atod.db.schemas.heroes_schema = {'Rolelevels': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'SurvivalRating': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'name': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'ProvidesBabysit': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'HeroType': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'MovementSpeed': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttackRate': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'Role': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'RequiresFarm': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'MovementTurnRate': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'aliases': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'AttackRange': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttributePrimary': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'AttributeAgilityGain': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'AttackAnimationPoint': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'ProvidesSetup': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttributeBaseIntelligence': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttackCapabilities': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'SoloDesire': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttackDamageMin': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttributeBaseAgility': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'RequiresSetup': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'in_game_name': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>, 'AttackDamageMax': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttributeStrengthGain': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'RequiresBabysit': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttributeIntelligenceGain': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'AttackAcquisitionRange': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'AttributeBaseStrength': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Integer'>, 'ArmorPhysical': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.Float'>, 'Team': <class 'sqlalchemy.sql.sqltypes.String'>}¶

Description of how get_<table name>_schema functions works and why.

In the source files FIELD_INTEGER and etc are used, schemas in order to be json serializable are described with the same strings. All get_<table name>_schema functions are doing the same job: * open db_schemas file * read needed dictionary * map strings to SQLAlchemy types * return results

atod.db.setup module¶

Setting up database.
